newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Fourth South Korean soldier dies in manhunt.
newsitem.headline: Fourth South Korean soldier dies in manhunt.

text.p: A South Korean soldier injured in a gunbattle with North Korean infiltrators on Monday died in hospital on Wednesday, a defence ministry spokesman said.
Army corporal Kim Dae-young was the fourth Southern soldier to die in a hunt for an estimated 26 North Koreans who came ashore from a submarine last week.
"He died of head injuries sustained during the shootout," the defence ministry spokesman said.

Last week a sergeant assigned to a paratrooper unit, another army corporal and a private were shot and killed in separate gunfights with heavily-armed North Korean agents in mountains near the east coast city of Kangnung.
So far 20 infiltrators have been killed and one captured. South Korean forces have shot dead one civilian by mistake.

Tens of thousands of security troops were still searching for the remaining fugitives to end one of the deadliest infiltrations by the North since the end of the 1950-53 conflict between the two Koreas.
